[Marko Chalupa](https://de.linkedin.com/in/marko-chalupa-45510066?trk=public_post_comment_actor-name)

7h

- [Report this comment](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Fsatyanadella_saving-marine-life-with-every-dive-activity-7376036936911790080-SOoe&trk=public_post_comment_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=COMMENT&_f=guest-reporting)

üåä Great example, [Satya Nadella](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_comment-text) - but here‚Äôs the blind spot: Removing ghost nets is not just about AI spotting them. It‚Äôs about what happens when systems drift.

The real risk isn‚Äôt missing a net - it‚Äôs when processes look ‚Äúsuccessful‚Äù but coherence is already lost:

‚Ä¢ Data pipelines still run, but validation breaks. ‚Ä¢ Models keep outputting, but without re-entry to reality. ‚Ä¢ Workflows look efficient, while meaning silently collapses.

üëâ In ocean cleanup, in energy grids, in airports - we‚Äôve seen the same: systems that continue formally while drifting structurally.

Resilience isn‚Äôt created by detection alone. It needs auditability under stress: ‚Ä¢ Drift Intensity: how far are we off course? ‚Ä¢ SnapReturn: can we re-enter stability without collapse? ‚Ä¢ DriftWindow: how long until coherence is restored?

AI that scales impact must not only ‚Äúsee the nets‚Äù; but also prove its own orbit under pressure. Otherwise, we risk cleaning oceans with models that themselves are silently drifting.

Resilience starts when purpose, not just process, is auditable.

#AI #Resilience #MeaningUnderLoad #DriftAudit
